radio_info.short: In 1997 a group of dreamers and visionaries in the border town of Bisbee, AZ, located in the Mule Mountains of the Chihuahuan desert, formed
radio_info.rest:
the Bisbee Radio Project, Inc. This non-profit endeavor was dedicated to bringing radio to Bisbee. Automated KBRP went on the air on November 21, 2004. Live programming began on the Winter Solstice, December 21, 2004.

In December of 2005, funds were raised within the community to hoist the antenna from the low point in Brewery Gulch to the top of the Central School Project Bell Tower. This strategic placement more than doubled the number of listeners who dwell in the winding canyons of the Mule Mountains.

Creating a community-run radio where there was  has been a true challenge for Bisbeeites, but the dream has become a reality. Participant Members dedicate their time and talents to manage all aspects of the radio station and are learning the myriad skills involved in running a full-time radio: studio-to transmitter technology, FCC rules and regulations, digital broadcasting, library maintenance and the production of programs, software programming, web design, news gathering, fund raising, database maintenance and the daily negotiation of creating and working together in community. KBRP was glad to make the move from the Brewery Gultch location to the Central School Project in the fall of 2008. KBRP is a bustling hub of activity, creation, fun, and information. KBRP Members produce a daily community calendar, animal rescue updates, local news, music, book reviews, educational programs and interviews. Now that KBRP is a Pacifica Network Affiliate, a National Federation of Community Broadcasters Participant Member, and a member of the World Association of Radio Broadcasters, it shares programming with a world- wide network of radio stations.

radio_info.short: A Mexican state prosecutor says a fire that tore through a day care center, killing 44 young children, may have been caused by a short
radio_info.rest:
circuit or overheating of a cooling system at a nearby warehouse.

Sonora state prosecutor Abel Murrieta issued his assessment Monday as more than 30 people remained hospitalized following Friday’s blaze at the ABC day care center.  The burn victims were being treated in both Mexico and the United States.

Officials say many of the victims who died from smoke inhalation were under the age of five.  Authorities have said more than 140 children were inside the facility when the blaze erupted in the building next door.

Witnesses said flames blocked the day care center’s only exit, and that one parent used his pickup truck to knock a hole through the wall to rescue children.

Authorities have vowed to fully investigate the fire.

The day care center had recently passed a safety inspection.

radio_info.short: KRDE - The Real Story In 1987 an FCC application window opened for a low power, 3 kw Class A* License in Globe. After a
radio_info.rest:
year of waiting for a comparative hearing, the first construction permit was granted. The following eight years were spent doing upgrade applications and engineering work.

Finally, in October of 1995, the station went on the air as KRXS (K Rocks 97.3) as a 25 kw Class C3* station. A lot of time was spent learning the radio business and finding a format that would work in attracting listeners and sponsors.

Another upgrade application was started in the never ending effort to improve the signal. In 2002 the station was granted a 50 kw Class C2*.

In 2005, as requested by the FCC, the station changed frequency to 94.1 FM. At that time the calls letters were changed to KRDE (The Ride) to reflect our Country music format. In 2005, we also purchase a building and moved our studio location to 800 N. Main Street in Globe, where we are currently located.

KRDE continues to improve and grow. In March of 2011 we again increased our power. The new, more powerful KRDE is now a 100 kw Class C1*.

KRDE is one of the few independently owned radio station in the United States.
The KRDE license is also one of the very few owned by a minority female.

radio_info.short: The Mission: Lake Havasu City was just a small spot on the Colorado River when Murphy Broadcasting first hit the airwaves here. Our aim was
radio_info.rest:
to build a company that could stand with the best broadcast facilities in the U.S. We achieved this by adhering to the following principles:

    1. Hire the best: Our marketing team members hail from all over the country, as far as New York and as close as down the street. We proudly boast over 60 years of broadcast experience, including decades of newspaper and magazine experience. - Meet our Staff -

    2. Stay ahead of the curve: Some of the things we have done may seem strange to people… such as sending over 1,000,000 faxes over a ten year period, delivering the news daily to tri-state residents. Then moving forward with electronic delivery with e-Press®, the area's only comprehensive newspaper. This was simply another way to keep in touch with our listeners, for the benefit of our advertisers.

    3. Learn and learn some more: Each year we spend tens of thousands of dollars training our people, teaching them about the businesses that advertise with us. Our training is extensive: we bring in trainers year after year from the Radio Advertising Bureau and the National Association
    of Broadcasters to train our people, who in turn, train other radio people!

What We Do to on Top:
While newspapers and other media are cutting back on local involvement, especially news, Murphy Broadcasting stations continues to expand further in these areas. With an average of eight local newscasts a day, www.JustSayNews.com, e-Press® and our 24 hour local news channel streaming on the Internet, Murphy Broadcasting is THE source for local news.

100% Locally Owned
100% Locally Operated
100% Locally Committed!

We live here...We work here...This is our home:
Our stock holders are like family. In fact, our stock holders are nearly 90% family! Rick Murphy, founder of the company was born in Parker and currently lives in Bullhead City, AZ. radios.title: KBach - KBAQ

radio_info.short: KBACH is locally hosted and programmed, providing classical music 24/7, centered on the Classical era and including much from the Baroque and Romantic eras. Eight
radio_info.rest:
Phoenix-based hosts, many musicians themselves, share their knowledge of the music along with news of the arts happenings in the Valley. 

The station carries the nationally syndicated program, Sunday Baroque with Suzanne Bona (Sundays 6am - 10am), and KBACH's own Matt Rogers has syndicated his weekly hour-long film music series, Reel Music (Saturdays 6pm). 

Seasonally, KBACH brings performances recorded in Arizona, including the Phoenix Symphony and the Phoenix Chorale, as well as visiting professional ensembles -- and ASU student and faculty performances. These broadcasts are heard some weeknights at 7pm when in season. KBACH's hosts are Sterling Beeaff, Jon Town, Matt Rogers, Brian Smith, Linda Cassidy, Janine Miller, Duart Martin, and Charlotte Wilson."

radios.title: Family Life Radio - KFLR-FM
radios.profile_slogan: A Ministry of Family Life Communications

radio_info.short: Born in 1927 in Grand Rapids, Michigan, Warren Bolthouse is a living example of what happens when God gives someone a vision. It's no surprise
radio_info.rest:
that Warren is the son of a builder, because for 30 years he has been dedicated to building the ministry of Family Life Radio. He and his wife, Char, met in their teenage years while singing and traveling with the "Children's Bible Hour." They were married in 1947.

From there, Warren and Char were called to be involved as music ministers, assistant pastors or youth directors for church ministries in Michigan and New York. Even in the midst of this pastoral work, the couple had a dream of seeing non-commercial Christian radio in every home. Following their ministry in New York, Warren and Char and their five children moved back to Michigan and settled in the Jackson area. It was there, in a clapboard house on Jericho Road, that the dream of Christian radio started to come alive. Family Life Radio was born in the basement studio of Warren and Char's home, with a 30-minute radio program for teenagers.

While the rich history of Family Life Radio is captured in the book "On The Jericho Road: The Family Life Radio Story,"  you must forward almost 40 years later to understand the magnitude of the work God has done in Family Life Radio; you must look at today, where you find a network of over 30 stations and station transmitters around the United States. 

With the broadcasting reach out to nearly 15 million people, Family Life Radio has grown.  But more importantly than anything, God has cast his favor upon the faithful ministry that started in a small room 42 years ago in Michigan, and now touches lives for Christ everyday across the entire nation and around the world.


Dr. Randy L. Carlson, President of Family Life Radio, and the leadership team of Rod Robison, Alonzo Williams and the Board of Directors, and countless others who make this ministry possible with labor and love, are here daily, to be faithful servants, mindful stewards, and passionate to spread the Gospel of Christ in a dark and fallen world!

radio_info.short: A Brief History Calvary Community Church was started in 1982 by Pastor J. Mark Martin. Calvary, a non-denominational church, started with only 11 people in
radio_info.rest:
a northwest Phoenix elementary school band room and today has grown to be the church home for over 12,000. Rapid growth eventually led to the purchase of our present facility, a former shopping center adjacent to the Black Canyon Freeway. Calvary continues to grow enjoying a new, state of the art Children's Ministries facility and exciting plans for a new extension Campus at 59th Avenue and Bell.
A Calvary Chapel

In 1984 Pastor Chuck Smith of Calvary Chapel of Costa Mesa, California invited Pastor Mark and the Calvary Community family to join the Calvary Chapel fellowship of churches. Pastor Mark has often said, "Throughout the years we've seen God work in extraordinary ways. We've seen through this work that where God guides, God provides."
Our Vision

   1. To Exalt Jesus Christ
   2. To Equip His Saints
   3. To Evangelize His Earth


Our worship services on Saturday evening and Sunday morning center around praising our Lord Jesus in song and discovering His love and direction for us through His Word. The Sunday evening service emphasizes a time of celebration through worship and communion and the study of the Word.View our Service Times

Because the Bible is the living and authoritative Word of God, we meet Wednesday nights to study it chapter by chapter, verse by verse. We've found that this balanced approach to Bible study helps us to grow as God applies His Word in our lives.

One of the best possible ways to experience solid growth in your Christian life is by becoming involved in a Bible study.These smaller, more intimate groups provide the kind of environment where you can find New Testament "Fellowship"; that is, the sharing of our common life in Jesus Christ.  See our list of Weekly Classes and Home Bible Studies for a study that will fit your needs.

radios.title: The News 1490AM - KYCA

radio_info.short: The News 1490 has been serving Prescott and the surrounding area for 71 years, providing news and other programming to the rapidly-growing area since before
radio_info.rest:
World War II. 
      KYCA was part of the Arizona Radio Network and owned by KTAR radio in Phoenix. The station was acquired by Southwest Broadcasting in 1970, and remains under that ownership today. 
     KYCA, an affiliate of the Fox News Radio Network and Westwood One, has been a leader from day one in local, state and national news and sports coverage for the Prescott area. 
     KYCA began the transition to full-time news-talk radio with the premiere of The Rush Limbaugh Show in 1988 (KYCA was one of the original affiliates of Rush's show) and The Dr. Dean Edell Show a few years later. Both programs remain on KYCA to this day, along with a talk lineup which includes many of today's top rated talent, including Sean Hannity, Laura Ingraham, Jerry Doyle, Michael Savage and more.

radio_info.rest:
o is often referred to as Amateur Radio and is a hobby that is enjoyed by millions of individuals across the globe. A ham radio operator uses a two-Way Radio to broadcast with other amateurs for the purpose of entertainment, public service or other venture.

The use of ham radio may actually help to save lives as operators often support the local community with emergency and disaster communications. On a recreational basis, ham radio can help to increase an individual?s self awareness of electronics, the operations of radio and communication. In addition, ham radio is often used to showcase entertainment for listeners and may even help to launch a new career for an amateur.

radio_info.short: Arizona Gold KAZG is the Valley’s lone remaining oldies station with constant gifts of “14 in a Row” commercial-free music. Where else can you hear
radio_info.rest:
more Turtles, Four Tops, and Tommy James– as well as the Beau Brummels and Herb Alpert? This “Arizona Goldmine” has it all.


Recently, a few shows have been added to the station’s daily programming. The long-running Valley food and restaurant show, “Culinary Confessions with Kim & Don”, air weekdays 11am to 1pm. A sports-talk show called “The Bandwagon”, air weekdays 4pm to 7pm. Both shows have been rescued from AM 1310 KXAM, which went dark in mid-April 2009.
 KAZG’s real secret fanbase, however, has been compiled of those oldies-lovers. They commonly refer to the station as the “Lumberyard”, for its radio tower location that only they would likely know off the top of their heads. The tower is directly behind a lumberyard on the southeast corner of 64th St. and Thomas Rd., and the transmitter building is accessed from a dirt path parallel to the canal.

radios.title: Inside Jazz - The Mix
radios.profile_slogan: Because the Best Jazz is Live!

radio_info.short: As the world's only radio station featuring All Live recorded music, we are just overflowing with exceptional live music, and we want it to sound
radio_info.rest:
the very best for you. 

THE MIX - This channel continues to give you the widest variety of music and styles as it contains every song in our growing library. If we have it in rotation, you'll definitely hear it here.
  
STRAIGHTEN UP - This channel gives you the very best in Straight Ahead jazz. Everything from solo piano to burning big bands. If it's classics and standards you love, this is your home.
  
CONTEMPORARY - This channel brings you more vocals, more originals, and some exciting performances by the biggest names in Contemporary jazz. Everyone loves Contemporary jazz.
  
FUSION - The name says it all. If you like the creative use of instruments and you appreciate excellent musicianship, then you will enjoy what this channel has to offer. 

Inside Jazz is pleased to announce we have established a fantastic new relationship with SelectRadio of Phoenix, Arizona. 

Inside Jazz will provide a significant amount of our exciting live music library for exclusive streaming on a new 'Inside Jazz' channel provided by SelectRadio.

So if you have a Windows Mobile phone that you use for email, why not use it to get Inside Jazz anywhere! With SelectRadio, you can tap the entire variety of Inside Jazz channels and concert archives with pushbutton ease.

Take a break from your email and turn that new Windows Mobile handheld into a personalized radio receiver today. Download SelectRadio for a 10-day free trial and change the way you listen to the music you love.

METRO SESSIONS - 

We have entered into an exclusive partnership with Rocco Somazzi to bring you an incredible new music series featuring the very best of Rocco's creative booking expertise in Los Angeles. Rocco is known for his visionary booking policies, and Metro Sessions captures all of this and puts it right at your fingertips.

Metro Session can be heard exclusively in the new On Demand section of Inside Jazz.

MORE CONTEMPORARY JAZZ -

Speaking of Rendezvous, we made our way down to Thornton Winery to capture a special show featuring the Rendezvous Allstars. On hand were Kirk Whalum, Wayman Tisdale, Jonathan Butler, Brian Simpson - and a special appearance from 'Peanuts'. Special thanks to Scott Pederson from Scottand Concerts for making it possible for us to bring you this great show. Look for it in the On Demand section of Inside Jazz.

radio_info.short: 1FaithFM.com was launched to provide a worldwide source of Christ inspired music for people of all ages and musical tastes. Our passion is for all
radio_info.rest:
styles of Christian music and a desire to share it with the world.

We provide a wide variety of music formats to our listeners, We have many new and exciting stations currently being formatted and will be launching them soon.

The different music formats at 1FaithFM.com cover well known artists of past and present, as well as up and coming artists and new styles of music. Updating our database of music is always an ongoing process to keep up with new artists, styles, and releases.

Most of our staff have been involved in the Christian music or the radio industry for many years and truly understand the passion these artists have for their music and their ministry. Our goal is to do whatever we can to provide an avenue for them to entertain and to minister.

Our goal is not only to attract visitors to our site for the music, we believe 1Faithfm.com was built through our own testimony of Christ and believe music has the ability to touch lives with the Gospel of our Lord.

Bookmark our site for great music and to keep up with all of the great things happening here at 1FaithFM.com !

radios.title: On Tha Move Radio
radios.profile_slogan: Putting Music back in the Black

radio_info.short: I joined the Vocalized Ink a website forum and radio community geared at promoting poetry in its written and spoken form though blog posts and
radio_info.rest:
a play list driven online radio broadcast. I was associated with other web sites that promoted poetry in its written form and held phone cyphers for those to spit their performance pieces. After hanging around for a year I took myself to an offline weekend sponsored by the founders and members at Vocalized Ink. It was during this weekend that a friendship and business relationship was formed between myself and Sherrie-Ann Towns (Sherykah) and Vonetta Truitt (UbZoRbShUn) the founders of Vocalized Ink. I also met others who would later become key players in my journey in producing online radio.

My first endeavor in online radio came when Sherykah asked me to assist with building the weekly playlist and assume duties on the radio side of Vocalized Ink. We worked with the closely affiliated House of Ra website and forum that allowed users to submit audio productions of their spoken word pieces. Eventually I took over the role of program director for the station. Trying to keep the content current and interesting, I developed a show “Budda’s Picks Of The Week”. Initially a pre-recorded show hosted by myself that featured select performance poetry from what had evolved into the VI Radio catalog (a merger between Vocalized Ink and House of Ra). The show evolved into a weekly “live and unscripted” venue when guest turned co-host UbZoRbShUn joined the broadcast. We logged over 110 episodes during our run on VI Radio.

During my tenure as program director, new radio shows were produced and aired on the station in its playlist format. Sherykah then approached me about her idea of moving to a new broadcasting platform that was more consistent with the current trend in online radio. This meant we had to learn new technologies and methods beyond creating simple playlists. Both Sherykah and I were no strangers to technology as she was a webmaster and I a 20something year veteran in information technology. So, the challenges ahead had more to do with sharing knowledge and training our djs and personalities. We shared this responsibility and moved VI Radio into the online radio industry as a fully licensed Internet broadcast.

The new technology enhanced our capabilities and our dedication to the spoken word movement made us stand-alone for many years. Instead of using the station as a profit wheel, we decided to use it as a vehicle to serve the community. Our catalog had grown beyond our comprehension. We were gaining popularity with artists solely dedicated to the art-form and a host of up and coming performance poets. After the split with the House of Ra, we found ourselves sufficiently provided for in terms of audio content. We also wanted to turn our attentions more toward radio production as in developing radio personalities and radio shows.

There was an abundance of talent inside of the Vocalized Ink community. Many of those affiliated with the House of Ra and Vocalized Ink forums stayed on-board with the station. Shows such as NCSolitude’s Bedtime Stories (almost 10 years on-air) and BrownSkinPoetic’s PoeticSoul series (Now known as OnTheMic) existed long before Budda’s Picks of the Week and continue to be present in the OnThaMoveRadio.com lineup. Sherykah was integral in helping show hosts acquire the skills and tools needed to produce program segments for radio. The outcome being shows such as Big Trigger’s Spotlight On Jazz & Poetry, LadyB’s Old Skool Cafe (logo design by Sherykah), and Reason, Season, A Lifetime. Shows such as Fisiwe’s LoveArtLife Radio, RevolutionaryArtShow, Dean Speaks, Land Of Hip Hop, Aphrodesia, Taste of Romance, Indie-Artist Showcase, and DP’s FunkHouse came by way of experienced radio personalities with backgrounds as performance poets, actors, singers or a combination of all.

After a 5-year run and a failed attempt to convert VI Radio and its social network into a non-profit organization, a business decision was made to dissolve the existing organization as we came to know it. The founding members were all dealing with personal life issues which left little time to manage the web site which eventually fell prey to dozens of copyright infringements. This put us at risk of being pursued by regulatory authorities. The social network was shut down and I was prepared to walk away from the online radio business. I received a call from one of the long-term producers at the station who urged me to continue and said I was a natural at running this type of operation. I took the bait and decided to launch OnThaMoveRadio in the fall of 2008. Having the background, content and access to talent, provided me with a good start. The new station would leverage the lessons learned at VI Radio and incorporate the full spectrum of music from all making no distinction between mainstream and indie-artist.

Fortunately, many of the radio personalities and djs stayed with me in this endeavor. And as we close in on two years in October (2008 to Present), as OnThaMoveRadio.com, we are pleased to have our long running radio shows and personalities along with new program segments and personalities. The quality of our programming continues to top that of our online radio contemporaries. OnThaMoveRadio.com is an experience in radio broadcasting not just webcasting.

We celebrate the early pioneers in producing online radio content by featuring their past shows from the VI Radio vault and the OnThaMoveRadio catalog in our homepage Music section. We also would like to extend an open invitation for these and others to join the OnThaMoveradio.com’s family of programming. Please send your inquires to mp3submit@onthamoveradio.org.

Many thanks to all of our current personalities and djs. I would also like to give special thanks to Lisa Sullivan our current program director for her dedication and friendship.

radios.title: Sun Sounds of Arizona - Tempe

radio_info.short: Sun Sounds bridges the information gap between current print media and people who cannot use it because of a disability. Mission: Sun Sounds of Arizona
radio_info.rest:
provides audio access to information to people in the Southwest who cannot read print because they have a disability.


Vision: Sun Sounds of Arizona will make creative use of technology and talent to ensure that every disabled person has the opportunity to access the current and local information necessary to a self-directed, productive life. As a result, the inability to read print will no longer be considered a disabling condition. Sun Sounds of Arizona will continue to be a leader in the field of information access services and a willing partner to organizations with like goals. Sun Sounds of Arizona is innovative, committed to quality and to customer satisfaction.

The audience of Sun Sounds of Arizona is as diverse as the population in general. This is because people lose the ability to read print material for a vast number of reasons. Many lose their access to print late in life as a result of macular degeneration, diabetes, or other age related eye diseases. Others lose the ability to use print because of a stroke, accident, or age-related infirmity. After a lifetime of reading newspapers, popular magazines, books and other current print, the sudden and dramatic loss of reading ability can bring a sense of great loss and isolation.

Sun Sounds provides access to print on the radio, Internet and telephone. The radio service is an audio presentation which can be carried on an FM station in a hidden portion of the signal called a subcarrier or as an audio only service on cable. By providing the programming of a reading service it is possible for eligible listeners to hear daily newspapers, grocery ads, death notices, and other printed news used in day-to-day living.

From the travel column in the newspaper to the local electoral results current print makes a difference in the lives of Arizonans. When volunteers from Sun Sounds’ studios read from daily papers, magazines grocery ads, and best seller books access to current print is restored and the sense of isolation is diminished making independent living much easier.

Anyone who cannot read print because of a medical disability can sign-up for service. There is no fee to users. A program schedule is provided to help listeners tune in at the right time for the daily newspaper such as the Wall Street Journal, Arizona Regional papers, or USA Today. Other print information read aloud is from local grocery or department stores and even best-seller books are provided in serialized form. 
Another interesting fact about Sun Sounds is that the on-air voices are all those of volunteers. There are hundreds of volunteers who provide this help throughout Arizona, including those in Sun Sounds' offices in Flagstaff and Tucson. 

Sun Sounds of Arizona launched the first of its kind telephone based reading service, Sun Dial.  Sun Dial combines the intimacy of a volunteer reading live on the radio with the functionality of a web browser. Following voice prompts over the telephone and having no more sophisticated equipment beyond a touch-tone phone, a Sun Dial subscriber can hear Sun Sounds live, hear today's newspaper from prerecorded articles, and surf the internet from pre-selected web pages in the Sun Dial menu.

Sun Dial was the first of its type to combine these functions, and remains an innovator by using both human readers and synthesized speech to create an information access point for any registered user. Like the broadcast based service, anyone who cannot use print because of a disability is eligible to use Sun Dial at no charge. .
